title: Firefox: Move Find bar to the top
content:
I recently upgraded my system and, after installing and using Firefox, I notice the Find (Ctrl + F) bar is now at the bottom of the window. Whereas, it was previously at the top (which is more like every other application I use).

After some head scratching and web searches, I remembered I had to fix this issue previously (after a Firefox upgrade some time back). The method to fix it then could be found here: [there a way to put the Find Bar at top] That link is of course to the same question asked 4 years back.

I have once again followed the procedure there explained per: • Access my Firefox profile folder. In my case: 

  C:\Users\<Me>\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\5ym42ewi.default

• Create folder therein called ‘chrome’ • In that folder create a file called ‘userChrome.css’ • In that file add text: 

  .browserContainer > findbar {     -moz-box-ordinal-group: 0;   }

However, after doing that (and restarting Firefox), the Find bar stubbornly remains glued to the bottom of the window.

Can anyone tell me how to solve this issue?

As a separate note to the developers: This issue is long-standing, that a web search reveals is still relevant to many users. Any chance of considering making it a standard option?
creator: Spinner4000

title: Firefox not opening after Windows 10 Security Update
content: I downloaded a Windows 10 update last night. It was Security Intelligence Update for Microsoft Defender Antivirus - KB2267202 (Version 1.361.793.0). Now, I cannot open Firefox. When I click on Firefox for around half a second I see an error box that says "Open Firefox in troubleshooting mode?" and nothing else, with no option to click yes, then the box closes. The same thing happens when I try to run firefox.exe -p to change profiles. I also cannot open Tor Browser, and I am wondering if there is a connection. I have tried uninstalling Firefox using the uninstall tool and reinstalling but I have the same issue. I uninstalled the windows update and opened Firefox. This time, it had the "Open Firefox in troubleshooting mode?" box but I could actually click on the yes option, and Firefox opened. However, when I clicked on the option to get a fresh install and remove the extensions, Firefox closed and I am back to the same place of it not being able to open again.
creator: alexestein

title: Heslo
content:
Dobrý den, mám problém s nesrovnalostí hesla k účtu Firefoxu. Na novém zařízení se snažím přihlásit heslem, které mám uloženené ve FFSync, ale to není akceptováno. Pokud se chci přihlásit na zařízení, které je přihlášeno do FFSync, heslo je ověřeno a systém mě přihlásí. Heslo zadávám stejné. Prosím o vyřešení

Děkuji S pozdravem Tomáš
creator: HavoCz

title: Recently added extensions not showing up anywhere
content: Hi. Here's the problem. I've recently added a couple of extensions to Firefox (Easy Youtube Video Downloader Express & AdBlocker for YouTube™). I don't see the icon for these extensions in the toolbar. When I go to the toolbar customizing page, I don't see the icons in the list to add to toolbar. So I don't even know how to use the Youtube downloader extension when I can't even click on or open it in any way.
